result.execSummary:
The defendant Cori S. Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a Park], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

All conditions of probation shall become conditons of extended supervision should probation be revoked
Consecutive to: to any other sentence previously imposed

State of Wisconsin apprs by Atty Kurt Klomberg.  DEF, Cori Smith apprs in person; in custody along with Atty Annamarie Wineke.  Parties agree with outcome of PSI.  Atty Wineke calls Jeff Smith - sworn/addresses the Court.  Steps down.  State heard/5 felonies (along with14CF300) to be addressed for sentencing/makes recomm.  Parties agree on 168 days jail credit against revocaton.  Atty Wineke heard/makes recomm.  DEF makes statement.  State requests $380.00 is owed by DEF, Atty Wineke agrees.  Court heard/orders:

Impose/Stay 8 Years Prison (4 in and 4 out)
with Substance Program and any other
Probation 4 Years/with Conditions
Rest $380.00

14CF300 & 14CF301 - Defendant Cori S. Smith in court with attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Wineke is not contesting state's motion to revoke DPA;  court orders DPA revoked.  Atty Klomberg heard;  request $2,500 cash bail and PSI, will be recommending a lengthy prison sentence.  Atty Wineke responds.  

Court heard;  revokes DPA, accepts plea and orders judgment of conviction be entered.  Court sets cash bail at $2,500 w/all prior conditions;  PSI ordered.  Defendant taken into custody. Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
